title: How to Use Mpix

steps.headline: Go to Mpix.com.
steps.description: If you don't have an account, go to the registration page to sign up for an account.

steps.headline: Create an album.
steps.description: Click on the 'Create New Album' and type in the name of the album that you want to create.

steps.headline: Upload images.
steps.description: You will need to download Java to enable the uploader.

steps.headline: Click on 'Add Photos'.
steps.description: This will bring you to the Desktop of your computer. If that isn't where your photos are, navigate to the correct location. Note the 'ubiquitous' shot of the cat in the rat cage.

steps.headline: Select the images.
steps.description: You are not restricted to one folder at a time. Navigate to the various locations on your computer and select your photos.

steps.headline: Once you have them selected, 'Upload' them.
steps.description:
After you have uploaded them, look around. You can do a variety of things with them. Things like:
Sharing them with others
Get them mounted
Wall clings
Greeting cards
Calendars
Magazine covers
Trading cards
Photo albums, and many other things.

steps.headline: Keep in mind that, depending on the size of the image, you will be restricted as to what you can do with each image.
steps.description: Always keep in mind the image's size.

text:
Go to Mpix.com. If you don't have an account, go to the registration page to sign up for an account. Create an album. Click on the 'Create New Album' and type in the name of the album that you want to create. Upload images. You will need to download Java to enable the uploader. Click on 'Add Photos'. This will bring you to the Desktop of your computer. If that isn't where your photos are, navigate to the correct location. Note the 'ubiquitous' shot of the cat in the rat cage. Select the images. You are not restricted to one folder at a time. Navigate to the various locations on your computer and select your photos. Once you have them selected, 'Upload' them. After you have uploaded them, look around. You can do a variety of things with them. Things like:
Sharing them with others
Get them mounted
Wall clings
Greeting cards
Calendars
Magazine covers
Trading cards
Photo albums, and many other things. Keep in mind that, depending on the size of the image, you will be restricted as to what you can do with each image. Always keep in mind the image's size.
